pr_title: NXP-29564 : Add use of FSExporter with collections

timeline.body:
You could use the functional API there.
```suggestion
        return collectionAdapter.getCollectedDocumentIds()
                                .stream()
                                .map(IdRef::new)
                                .map(session::getDocument)
                                .collect(Collectors.collectingAndThen(Collectors.toList(), DocumentModelListImpl::new));
```
Note: the two methods from _Collectors_ could be imported statically.
timeline.bodyHTML:
You could use the functional API there.

Suggested change
List<String> collectedDocumentIds = collectionAdapter.getCollectedDocumentIds();
List<DocumentModel> collectedDocumentsList = new ArrayList<DocumentModel>();
for (int i = 0; i < collectedDocumentIds.size(); i++) {
collectedDocumentsList.add(session.getDocument(new IdRef(collectedDocumentIds.get(i))));
}
DocumentModelList collected = new DocumentModelListImpl(collectedDocumentsList);
return collected;
return collectionAdapter.getCollectedDocumentIds()
.stream()
.map(IdRef::new)
.map(session::getDocument)
.collect(Collectors.collectingAndThen(Collectors.toList(), DocumentModelListImpl::new));

Note: the two methods from Collectors could be imported statically.
timeline.author: kevinleturc

timeline.body:
In order to work correctly in the CI you should use `FeaturesRunner.getBuildDirectory()` method and then gives this folder to a `TemporaryFolder` rule such as below:
```
    @Rule
    public TemporaryFolder folder = new TemporaryFolder(new File(FeaturesRunner.getBuildDirectory()));
```
Then in your test code:
```
folder.newFolder("fs-exporter").getAbsolutePath()
```
Note: `fs-exporter` is there to add isolation between tests.
timeline.bodyHTML:
In order to work correctly in the CI you should use FeaturesRunner.getBuildDirectory() method and then gives this folder to a TemporaryFolder rule such as below:

    @Rule
    public TemporaryFolder folder = new TemporaryFolder(new File(FeaturesRunner.getBuildDirectory()));

Then in your test code:

folder.newFolder("fs-exporter").getAbsolutePath()

Note: fs-exporter is there to add isolation between tests.
timeline.author: kevinleturc

timeline.message: NXP-29564 : Add use of FSExporter with collections
NXP-29564 : Add use of FSExporter with collections
NXP-29564 : Add use of FSExporter with collections

timeline.body:
I'm not a fan of `collectingAndThen` here @kevinleturc. I find it more readable to write

    List<DocumentModel> docs = collection.getAdapter(Collection.class)
                                         .getCollectedDocumentIds()
                                         .stream()
                                         .map(IdRef::new)
                                         .map(session::getDocument)
                                         .collect(Collectors.toList());
    return new DocumentModelListImpl(docs);

But if we inline this in the caller we don't even need the `DocumentModelListImpl` or the `Collectors.toList`.
timeline.bodyText:
I'm not a fan of collectingAndThen here @kevinleturc. I find it more readable to write
List<DocumentModel> docs = collection.getAdapter(Collection.class)
                                     .getCollectedDocumentIds()
                                     .stream()
                                     .map(IdRef::new)
                                     .map(session::getDocument)
                                     .collect(Collectors.toList());
return new DocumentModelListImpl(docs);

But if we inline this in the caller we don't even need the DocumentModelListImpl or the Collectors.toList.
timeline.bodyHTML:
I'm not a fan of collectingAndThen here @kevinleturc. I find it more readable to write

List<DocumentModel> docs = collection.getAdapter(Collection.class)
                                     .getCollectedDocumentIds()
                                     .stream()
                                     .map(IdRef::new)
                                     .map(session::getDocument)
                                     .collect(Collectors.toList());
return new DocumentModelListImpl(docs);

But if we inline this in the caller we don't even need the DocumentModelListImpl or the Collectors.toList.
timeline.author: efge

timeline.bodyHTML:
For new code we often write functionally:

String path = serialized.getAbsolutePath();
exporter.getCollectedDocuments(session, doc)
        .forEach(collected -> serializeStructure(session, path, collected, PageProvider));

Although with my other suggestion to get rid of the exporter.getCollectedDocuments method it'll look a bit different.
timeline.author: efge

timeline.body: This doesn't need to be a method in the `FSExporterPlugin` interface. Just inline the actual implementation into its caller, in `FSExporter.export` in the `if` statement.
timeline.bodyText: This doesn't need to be a method in the FSExporterPlugin interface. Just inline the actual implementation into its caller, in FSExporter.export in the if statement.
timeline.bodyHTML: This doesn't need to be a method in the FSExporterPlugin interface. Just inline the actual implementation into its caller, in FSExporter.export in the if statement.

timeline.body:
Let's be fully functional:

    String path = serialized.getAbsolutePath();
    doc.getAdapter(Collection.class)
       .getCollectedDocumentIds()
       .stream()
       .map(IdRef::new)
       .map(session::getDocument)
       .forEach(collected -> serializeStructure(session, path, collected, PageProvider));

And remove unneeded imports.
timeline.bodyText:
Let's be fully functional:
String path = serialized.getAbsolutePath();
doc.getAdapter(Collection.class)
   .getCollectedDocumentIds()
   .stream()
   .map(IdRef::new)
   .map(session::getDocument)
   .forEach(collected -> serializeStructure(session, path, collected, PageProvider));

And remove unneeded imports.

replies.bodyText: Is it really better than a for loop?

Ah indeed if serializeStructure can throw IOException then we reach the limitations of lambdas...
Ok as it is then.
